misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No clear misconception evident (correct control-flow model)
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes nested loops can build each row of a triangle by printing a growing number of '*' characters, then moving to a new line after each row.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: There isn’t an apparent gap here: the student’s mental model matches Java’s execution model (outer loop controls rows, inner loop controls columns/asterisks, println ends the row).
misconceptions.error_manifestation: No error; the program should produce the required triangle for positive integer input.
